pr_title: Migrate reconciliation calls to Apache HTTP client

timeline.message: Migrate reconciliation calls to OkHTTP, for #2903
Migrate data extension to Apache HTTP client

timeline.bodyText: 10 seconds should be fine for any reasonable service, but I wonder if it will be enough for Wikidata.
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText: 10 seconds will indeed be too short for Wikidata, complex queries can take 1 sec so batches of 10 queries would be likely to overrun.
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText:
Could you just use LaxRedirectStrategy here?
The docs only mention 301, 302, & 307. Is the lack of 308 a documentation oversight or a missing capability?
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText:
Thank you! The amazing thing is that I first defined my own subclass of DefaultRedirectStrategy and picked the same LaxRedirectStrategy name for it.
About HTTP 308: all I know is that it works with the HTTP 308 that Wikidata serves at the moment. Where did you see the mention of these specific codes?
replies.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText: 308 is newer, so it's probably a doc oversight. Doc page is here: https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-client-ga/httpclient/apidocs/org/apache/http/impl/client/DefaultRedirectStrategy.html
replies.author: tfmorris

timeline.bodyText: Old code used a connection timeout of 5 sec. I'm not sure if there was a reason and 30 sec seems fine to me, so just noting the difference.
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think it makes sense to use the same connection settings for reconciliation endpoints, and I anticipate this code being refactored to be shared.
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText: Is this  (and CloseableHttpClient) thread-safe? I haven't traced how this is used, but it seems unusual and perhaps risky to be reusing it in multiple, perhaps simultaneous, performQuery() method calls.
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText:
In the current architecture it should not be used concurrently but for good measure I can instantiate it with
MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager (https://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/threading.html)
replies.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText: This actually belongs to a different library, so let's keep it that way - a Job only gets executed in a single thread anyway, so no need to add this overhead anyway.
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText: Since there's no issue with static access, can't this just be initialized in the constructor?
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText: My intention was to try to avoid any overhead there, since this class is deserialized quite often (as soon as you have a reconciled column in the project, it will get saved / restored every time you save the ColumnModel)
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText: I have a feeling I may not want to know the answer to this, but why does an importer test have a dependency on reconciliation? That seems very odd.
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText: Because the importer itself depends on reconciliation to create reconciled cells?
replies.author: wetneb

timeline.bodyText: This needs to handle a JsonParseException either here or in the surrounding try/except block.
timeline.author: tfmorris

replies.bodyText: JsonException is a sublcass of IOException, so isn't the current handling of IOException enough? What specific action do you want to take when a JsonParseException is raised?
replies.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText: OK, there must be some other issue then. The goal is to have OpenRefine return an error to the user rather than just stay frozen with its spinner up as shown by the screen capture and server traceback in issue #2903.
replies.author: tfmorris

timeline.message: Remove read and pool timeouts, only keep the connection timeout
Adapt mocking of HTTP calls after migration
